subject: Re: [junit] Using parallel computer in JUnit 4.6
msgSnippet: Wow.  Total code review fail on our part. Can you log a high-priority bug?  We ll smash this bug for 4.7, possibly next week s snapshot.  If you feel really
messageBody:
Wow. Total code review fail on our part.

Can you log a high-priority bug? We'll smash this bug for 4.7,
possibly next week's snapshot. If you feel really motivated and are
skilled in git, feel free to submit a patch. Thanks for keeping us
honest,

David Saff

On Thu, Apr 30, 2009 at 1:25 PM, mghongslo <mghongslo@...> wrote:
> I'm reviewing the experimental functionality of running parallel tests at the class level; i.e. Parallel.classes(), I notice in the ParallelComputer class, run() method there is a call get with a timeout for 2000 milliseconds. Is there a significant reason for this versus get() without any timeout? In conducting test without JUnit test cases, I'm finding this timeout feature creates timeout exceptions whereas running JUnit without the timeout allows my test to run successfully. Can anyone explain why this timeout is needed?
>
>
>
